definition: to polish (a piece of writing)/to add a few finishing touches to (a piece of writing, painting etc)

sentences.english: Use watercolor paints to touch up Polaroid transfers.
sentences.chinese: 使用水彩颜料来润色宝丽来转移。

sentences.english: After that, he said, he would need another six months to polish up the text for publication.
sentences.chinese: 之后，他表示需要六个月的时间去润色文字。

sentences.english: Dress up the oil way of the bush.
The editors have polished the manuscript.
sentences.chinese: 编辑们为这篇底稿进行了润色。

sentences.english: Embellishment and fluff are not necessary.
sentences.chinese: 华丽的润色是完全没有必要的。
他给图画作最后的润色。

sentences.english: You need to touch up the poem.
sentences.chinese: 你需要给这首诗润色一下。

sentences.english: Forget the charisma and the polished speeches.
sentences.chinese: 忘掉所谓的超凡魅力和精心润色的演讲吧。
这张照片已被润色过了。

sentences.english: You are now ready to polish up the first draft.
sentences.chinese: 现在，你要准备对第一份草稿进行润色了。

sentences.english: You need to touch in a few patches of colour with a fine brush.
sentences.chinese: 你还得用细笔略加几笔色彩来润色一下。

sentences.english: I need some time with the script.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一点时间润色脚本。

sentences.english: Your composition is good except for some overcolouring here and there.
sentences.chinese: 你的作文很好，除了个别地方有些过分润色。

sentences.english: The product cares not only the skin externally, but also whitens internally, may help you to get a hydrated skin quality.
sentences.chinese: 外在润色，内在美白，创作发现如初露珠凝般的肤质。

sentences.english: The senior editor emphasized that this article needed further polishing.
sentences.chinese: 编审特别提到，这篇文章需要进一步润色。

sentences.english: Leave the editing, for now you are only writing.
sentences.chinese: 不要修饰润色，因为现在，你仅仅在写作。

definition: to decorate/to adorn/to dress up/to polish (a written piece)/to qualify or modify (grammar)
remuneration for literary or artistic work
